text: Maria Casentini Maria Casentini (1778-1805) was an Austrian ballet dancer. She was engaged in Venice 1788-95 and at the Theater am Kärntnertor in 1796-1804 and internationally famous in her time. She is most known for her performance in Das Waldmädchen by Giuseppe Trafieri (1796), to whom she danced tvelwe variations of a Russian dance composed for her by Beethoven (WoO17).Clive, H.P, Beethoven and His World: A Biographical Dictionary == References == Category:1778 births Category:1805 deaths Category:18th-century Austrian ballet dancers Category:19th-century ballet dancers
title: Maria Casentini
